intro: Henriquezia longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled henriquezia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, while its flowers display vibrant colors, often in shades of red or orange. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
